SEOUL , South Korea - South Korea 's president said Monday that she will push to disband the coast guard in the wake of a ferry disaster last month that left more than 300 people dead or missing , calling its rescue operations after the disaster a failure .

SEOUL , South Korea - South Korea 's president said Monday that she will push to disband the coast guard in the wake of a ferry disaster last month that left more than 300 people dead or missing , calling its rescue operations after the disaster a failure .
Most of the victims were students from a high school near Seoul who were traveling to the southern tourist island of Jeju .
The coast guard 's rescue operations were virtually a failure , President Geun-hye Park said in a nationally televised speech .
She said she will push for legislation that would transfer the coast guard 's responsibilities to the National Police Agency and a new government body she plans to establish .

The final responsibility for not properly dealing with this incident is placed on me , she said .
Park has apologized for the incident at least three times .
Prosecutors last week indicted the ferry 's 15 crew members who were tasked with navigating the ship , four on homicide charges .
